newsitem.title: RUSSIA: PRESS DIGEST - IZVESTIA - RUSSIA - MAY 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - IZVESTIA - RUSSIA - MAY 27.

text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in the May 28 edition of Russia's Izvestia newspaper. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Moscow in Paris bids farewell to its superpower ambitions and bows to the fact it cannot stop NATO's eastwards expansion.
- Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin's visit to Kiev will show whether the time has come for President Boris Yeltsin to go to Ukraine to sign a comprehensive cooperation agreement.
- First Deputy Prime Minister Anatoly Chubais promises to overhaul the taxation system in Russia before the 1998 budget.
- Russia in 1997 will continue limited crediting of certain countries of the former Soviet bloc.
- British clothes factories turn to Russian producers in search of low costs and high quality.
